Talk_09:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>The polite way to enjoy it is to roll it
silently beneath the tongue, allowing it
to dissolve.<sp:5:1:0> Hm?
Oh me, oh my!
Talk_20:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01>I took a detour from my travels and came
all this way to try it, but there's nothing
to be done about it now.
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughS_01>Oh! My apologies for the delayed
introduction. The name's <clr:0000>Gomo<clr:ffff>.

I travel the world, sampling every rock
under the sun. I s'pose that's why I'm
known as Gomo the goromand.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>I must ask, have you any <clr:0000>flint <clr:ffff>to spare?
Inside some flint is a rare and especially
delectable <clr:0000>ripened flint<clr:ffff>.
<snd:Ease_01>If I could have any ripened <clr:0000><clr:ffff>flint you find,
I'd pay you <clr:0000>1,000 rupees <clr:ffff>per piece.

Ripened flint looks like normal <clr:0000><clr:ffff>flint, and
you won't know one way or the other if
it's ripened until you try eating it.
Talk_21:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Think_01>It's a shame, but it looks like <clr:0000>marbled
rock roast <clr:ffff>isn't on the menu anymore.
Talk_22:
<sp:3:0:2:0401><snd:Notice>Oh... Oh yes! There can be no doubt. That
delicate, earthy aroma. You have some,
do you not?
Talk_23:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Ease_01>I'm known as Gomo the goromand. I've
sampled nearly every rock in the world!

I'll blow through a mountain of rupees for
a mountain of exquisite rock.
Talk_24:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Think><clr:0000>Ripened flint <clr:ffff>is incredibly rare—you may
have a hundred flint pieces, and not
one yields the elusive ripened variety!
If you have <clr:0000>20 or more pieces <clr:ffff>of flint,
please, let me have them.
Talk_12:
<sp:3:0:2:0801>Sharp edges that bite at the tongue. A
gravelly mouthfeel with particulate that
sticks between the teeth.
<snd:Happy_01>There can be no doubt. This is indeed
authentic, ripened flint!
Talk_25:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Angry_00>I look forward...<sp:5:1:0>


<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Angry_01>to a stupendous...<sp:5:1:0>


<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughL_00>relationship with you!
Talk_00:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Ease_01>Here for Cooke's famous culinary
concoctions too?

Recently, I heard about a rare delicacy
being offered here known as <clr:0000>marbled
rock roast<clr:ffff>. I'm told it's indescribable!
<sp:3:0:2:0a00><snd:Think_01>I interrupted my travels to come try it, but
they're fresh out...

<sp:3:0:2:0701>Not sure <clr:0000>edible rocks <clr:ffff>would appeal to a
Hylian though. Too much tooth-crunch!

Normally, there's a menu just for Hylians,
but everything's sold out on that one
as well.
Seems like we're both out of luck, hm?
Talk_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Think><clr:0000>Ripened flint <clr:ffff>is a true delicacy.


If I may have any of your ripened flint,
I'll pay you <clr:0000>1,000 rupees <clr:ffff>per piece.

It looks like normal flint, and you won't
know one way or the other until you try
eating it.
Talk_14:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><clr:0000>Ripened flint <clr:ffff>is incredibly rare—eat a
hundred, and you still may not find even
one. So this isn't too surprising, really.
I shall spare no expense for ripened flint.
I'd be thrilled if you brought me more
to test out.
Talk_03:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Ease_01>There's no telling whether or not it's
ripened <clr:0000>flint <clr:ffff>until I eat it.

How much will you provide me with?
Talk_16: <sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:QuestionNormal_01>Could you hand them over all in one go?
Talk_17:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Ease_01>You here for Cooke's famous culinary
concoctions too?

<sp:3:0:2:0a01>I came here to sample the <clr:0000>marbled rock
roast<clr:ffff>, but it looks like they no longer
offer it.
Talk_18:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00><snd:Think>I even made a big detour out this way so
I could come try the <clr:0000>marbled rock roast<clr:ffff>
I've heard so much about.
To think it'd be sold out...
What a travesty.
Talk_19:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Ease_01>You here for Cooke's famous culinary
concoctions too?

<sp:3:0:2:0a01>I came here to try <clr:0000>marbled rock roast<clr:ffff>,
but it seems they're fresh out.
